skill.name: Next.js 16 Launchpad
skill.description: Next.js 16 with Turbopack, Cache Components, and proxy.ts. Use for bootstrapping, migrating, and building with App Router and React 19.
skill.summary: Next.js 16 with Turbopack, Cache Components, and proxy.ts. Use for bootstrapping, migrating, and bui...
skill.author: Calel33

security_audit.summary: This skill contains documentation and reference code for Next.js 16 development. A PowerShell bootstrap script is included for project setup but only runs standard Node.js/npm commands. No malicious behavior, data exfiltration, or credential theft detected.

content.value_statement: Need to build or migrate to Next.js 16 but unsure where to start? This skill provides Turbopack configuration, Cache Components patterns, and migration guidance for App Router projects.
actual_capabilities: Create new Next.js 16 projects with Turbopack and TypeScript
Configure Cache Components with custom cacheLife profiles
Migrate from Next.js 15 middleware.ts to proxy.ts
Implement Server Components and Client Components composition
Add authentication guards with proxy.ts for protected routes
Set up streaming with Suspense boundaries for better UX
limitations: Does not cover Pages Router or Next.js versions below 15
Does not support Edge runtime in proxy.ts

use_cases.title: Start a new Next.js 16 project
use_cases.description: Set up a production-ready Next.js 16 app with Turbopack, TypeScript, Tailwind, and App Router in minutes.

use_cases.title: Migrate from Next.js 15
use_cases.description: Follow step-by-step guides to migrate middleware.ts to proxy.ts, enable Cache Components, and update async APIs.

use_cases.title: Build advanced patterns
use_cases.description: Implement authenticated dashboards, cached API routes, and streaming UIs with best practices and real examples.

prompt_templates.title: Create a new project
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new Next.js 16 project with Turbopack, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and App Router. What are the commands and minimal file structure?

prompt_templates.title: Configure caching
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I enable Cache Components in Next.js 16? Show me how to use 'use cache' with cacheLife and cacheTag for a blog page.

prompt_templates.title: Migrate middleware
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a Next.js 15 middleware.ts file. How do I migrate it to proxy.ts in Next.js 16? Show me the changes needed.

prompt_templates.title: Build authenticated routes
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a proxy.ts file that protects /dashboard routes. Include session checking, cookie handling, and redirect logic for unauthenticated users.

output_examples.input: Create a Next.js 16 project structure with App Router and proxy.ts authentication
output: Project structure created with app/ directory containing layout.tsx, page.tsx, and proxy.ts
Root layout includes children and modal slots for parallel routes
Proxy configuration protects /dashboard routes with auth-token cookie check
Suspense boundaries included for loading states
Cache Components enabled with reactCompiler in next.config.ts

best_practices: Use Server Components by default and only mark components with 'use client' when interactivity is needed
Protect routes at the network boundary using proxy.ts for authentication checks before routing
Wrap dynamic content in Suspense boundaries and use 'use cache' for data that does not change frequently
anti_patterns: Do not use 'use cache' with cookies(), headers(), or other runtime request data
Do not forget to wrap dynamic content in Suspense when cacheComponents is enabled
Do not run proxy.ts on Edge runtime - it requires Node.js runtime

faq.question: What version of Node.js does Next.js 16 require?
faq.answer: Next.js 16 requires Node.js 20.9.0 or higher. Older versions like Node.js 18 are no longer supported.

faq.question: How do I opt out of Turbopack if needed?
faq.answer: Use the --webpack flag: next build --webpack. This is only recommended if you have custom webpack plugins that cannot be migrated.

faq.question: What is the difference between middleware.ts and proxy.ts?
faq.answer: middleware.ts runs on Edge runtime while proxy.ts runs on Node.js. proxy.ts is the recommended approach for Next.js 16.

faq.question: Does this skill execute code on my machine?
faq.answer: The skill only contains documentation and reference code. No code execution occurs unless you explicitly run the bootstrap script yourself.

faq.question: How do I configure custom cacheLife profiles?
faq.answer: Define custom profiles in next.config.ts under cacheLife property. Example: 'product-catalog' with stale, revalidate, and expire values in seconds.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with Next.js 14 projects?
faq.answer: This skill targets Next.js 16 features like Turbopack default and Cache Components. For Next.js 14, use an earlier version of this skill.
